result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peris Genesis Byrd

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 867134,
Payable Number: 277342,
Receipt Number: 22R 034449,
Amount: $20.00

10:37 AM Defendant Peris Genesis Byrd appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Anne Theresa Nack and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders $500 cash bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with Damon Allen, Keishawn Ballard or Dakota Von Davidson. Defendant must sign bond by October 26, 2022 or report to jail.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No contact directly or indirectly with Co Defendants Damon Allen, Dakota Von Davidson or Keishawn Ballard., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
